fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Business and Industry, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Transport, Borders and Security
inter_groups: Unmanned aviation is spread over different industry groups. The "drone" can be used in every branch. That is why the drone sector is a combination of different groups and authorities.

goals__remit: Unifly develops and commercialises software, specifically for the integration of drones in the existing manned aviation network. All aeronautical movements fall under ATM (Air Traffic Management). Because of the evolution and innovation, aviation as we know it today will have to develop new systems to guide air traffic, manned and unmanned, in good order. The goal of Unifly is to help the sector in doing this. To make those problems public, Unifly wants to inform and help all stakeholders were necessary, in order to create a safe airspace or to bring it under the attention. Unifly is looking forward to have a European version of NASA UTM. Europe has the necessary know-how to take the lead. Working together with companies on a worldwide basis is also the view of  Unifly.
